title.narrative: Output 2.1.2 Local authorities and communities in selected municipalities promote the increased use of priority life-saving health services for vulnerable children and women

description.narrative: Child survival improved through upgrade and standardization of child resuscitation services and implementing of new type of mechanism for provision of health services to young children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2017

title.narrative: : # of VHCs in 23 municipalities providing information on danger signs of child illnesses to families through outreach programs

actual.value: 2016:On track. 540 VHCs in all 180 villages in 23 municipalities are covered. In total, 15660 mothers and caregivers of children under 5 have been received information on danger signs of child illnesses. title.narrative: # of Village Health Committees (VHCs) in 23 municipalities providing information on complicated signs of pregnancy to pregnant women through outreach programs

actual.value: 2016:On track. 540 VHCs in all 180 villages in 23 municipalities are covered. In total, 5470 pregnant women have been received information on danger signs in pregnancy.
